#summary Rendering notes for the CheckBoxList control
#labels documentation,CheckBoxList

= Introduction =

Adapted content for the `CheckBoxList` control is available through the `CheckBoxListAdapter` or the `CssCheckBoxList` control.


= HTML Rendering =

The `CheckBoxList` is rendered as an unordered list (`UL`), with each checkbox included in a  list item (`LI`). Checkboxes are rendered as `input` tags of type `checkbox`. Each checkbox has a corresponding `label` tag unless there is no text or value assigned to the corresponding `ListItem`.

== Sample Markup ==

ASP.Net Code:
{{{
<asp:CheckBoxList ID="CheckBoxList1" runat="server">
	<asp:ListItem Value="0" Text="Normal" />
	<asp:ListItem Value="1" Text="Disabled" Enabled="false" />
	<asp:ListItem Value="NoText" />
	<asp:ListItem />
</asp:CheckBoxList>
}}}

Control Adapter markup:
{{{
<ul class="AspNet-CheckBoxList AspNet-CheckBoxList-RepeatDirection-Vertical" id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2">
	<li class="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Item"><input id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_0" name="ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$CheckBoxList2$0" type="checkbox" value="0" /><label for="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_0">Normal</label></li>
	<li class="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Item AspNet-CheckBoxList-Disabled"><input id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_1" name="ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$CheckBoxList2$1" type="checkbox" disabled="disabled" value="1" /><label for="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_1">Disabled</label></li>
	<li class="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Item"><input id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_2" name="ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$CheckBoxList2$2" type="checkbox" value="NoText" /><label for="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_2">NoText</label></li>
	<li class="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Item"><input id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_CheckBoxList2_3" name="ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$CheckBoxList2$3" type="checkbox" value="" /></li>
</ul>
}}}


= Configuration =

Configuration options include the following:

|| `CssClass` || The class applied to the unordered list. ||
|| `DisabledCssClass` || The class applied to the unordered list if it is not enabled, and to list items if their respective checkbox is not enabled. ||
|| `ItemCssClass` || The class added to each list item. ||
|| `RepeatDirectionCssClass` || The class added to the unordered list to denote the repeat direction (horizontal or vertical). Note that the `CheckBoxList`'s `RepeatDirection` is appended to this class to allow proper selectivity. ||

A sample configuration follows.

{{{
<CheckBoxList cssClass="AspNet-CheckBoxList" 
	  disabledCssClass="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Disabled"
	  itemCssClass="AspNet-CheckBoxList-Item" 
	  repeatDirectionCssClass="AspNet-CheckBoxList-RepeatDirection-" />
}}}


= Implementation Notes =

== CheckBoxList Properties ==

The following table outlines those properties of the `CheckBoxList` control that are implemented in the `CheckBoxListAdapter` control. Properties not listed are not supported or implemented.

|| *Property* || *Implementation* ||
|| `ClientID` || Used as the unordered list's `id` attribute. ||
|| `CssClass` || When not null or empty, it is added to the unordered list's `class` list. ||
|| `Enabled` || When set to `false`, the default `DisabledCssClass` is applied to the unordered list's `class` list and each list item's `class` list. ||
|| `Items` || All items in the control are rendered. Items which are disabled have the default `DisabledCssClass` applied to their list item tag. ||
|| `RepeatDirection` || The `RepeatDirection` is appended to the default `RepeatDirectionCssClass`. ||
|| `TextAlign` || Used to place the HTML `label` tag before or after the `input` checkbox. ||


== ListItem Properties Supported ==

The following table outlines those properties of the `CheckBoxList` control's `Items` collection that are implemented in the `CheckBoxListAdapter` control. Properties not listed are not supported or implemented.

|| *Property* || *Implementation* ||
|| `Enabled` || When disabled, the default `DisabledCssClass` is applied to the list item. ||
|| `Text` || Used as the text of the `label` tag. If this is not used, the `Value` property is used. If neither are used, the label is not rendered. ||
|| `Value` || Used as the checkbox's `value` attribute. Note that this is not added in standard ASP.Net markup. ||
